sector.name: Near Sweetgrove
sector.sign: Fort Talrus - 30 miles south|Blinlock - 45 miles northwest
sector.string: It looks like someone was camped here recently. Whoever they were, they cleaned up well when they left.
You find an empty farmhouse, surrounded by twisted and dying crops. The untended rows of corn around the house look like they've been rotting from the bottom up.
Some plots of corn have moldered entirely away, decomposing into a thick layer of odorous, diseased goo. The smell is hideous.
On the door of the farmhouse, you find a simple note: "Help yourself to the farm. And may the Gods help you if you take it."
Finding nothing of value, you leave.
This is quite an anomaly for Skylark Vale: a functioning farm. Smoke spirals up from the chimney, and the farmhouse is defiantly cheery in the face of the sickly crops all around it.
Go knock on the door?
You walk away, reassured that at least a few things in this valley haven't been given up for dead.
You knock on the door, and, after a long pause, it is answered by a huge, deeply tanned man. He looks you over, and lowers the heavy crossbow he held pointed at you.

He introduces himself as Cole and invites you in for bowls of stew and conversation. You talk for a while. He tells you horror stories of happenings in the valley, and you share news of the rest of the world.
After a time, he says "By the way, this farm is rather sick. The way I make a little extra is by selling supplies on the side. Interested?"
Cole's Supplies
Ever since you entered the Vale, you've detected this strange, bitter smell. Now, walking over this bridge, it becomes stronger, so strong you feel nauseous and faint.
Looking down, you realize where it must be coming from: the water! The smell coming up from the river burns your nose and makes your eyes water.
You hike through the stone circle, and find you're surrounded by bushes of wild strawberries. They look sickly, but still edible. Pick some?

You see cooking fires at the head of the valley, and approach cautiously. A quick scout ahead confirms your suspicions. A band of bandits are camped up here, counting up loot stolen from the beleaguered people of Skylark Vale.

Of course, you could always attack and teach them a good lesson. They look tough, but you would have the advantage of surprise. And, of course, you would be on the side of goodness, which always helps.
You're in luck! You charge the bandits, and they draw their weapons and attack you! You will be able to fight a glorious battle for the forces of goodness after all.
You back away nervously. Evil will just have to be vanquished another day.
You search the brigand camp, and find gold and food, and some nice arrows to boot! This is your lucky day!
A patrol of soldiers approaches, and, deciding you don't look too much like bandits, wander off.
You can't help but notice that it's pretty hot.
*End of special strs
